alert.note: Alert for Brown (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 6:29PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF MASON, ROBERTSON, BRACKEN AND SOUTHEASTERN BROWN COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 628 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Brooksville, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Maysville, Washington, Ripley, Aberdeen, Augusta, Lewisburg, Brooksville, Mount Olivet, Dover, Germantown, Sardis, Murphysville, Alhambra, Stonewall, Mays Lick, Powersville, Peed, Johnsville, Helena and South Ripley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
